text: Sen, Mark Warner: "The Special Counsel's report must be provided to Congress immediately, and the Attorney General should swiftly prepare a declassified version of the report for the public. Nothing short of that will suffice."
author: tedstew

text: My Roku wasn’t even a box but a $30 streaming stick.
author: tedstew

text: The Equal Time rule, though, is limited: news outlets are exempted, and over the years talk shows have been found to as well. When Trump hosted SNL in 2015, during the middle of the campaign, some NBC stations offered time to his GOP rivals after they requested it.
author: tedstew

text: The Fairness Doctrine is often mistaken for the Equal Time rule, which is still in place and has to do with stations offering candidates for public office equal amounts of airtime — if one candidate appears, they may have to offer the same amount to a rival.
author: tedstew

text: This appears to be an argument for the Fairness Doctrine, which the Reagan-era FCC abandoned in the 1980s. It’s actually been Republicans who have warned for years that Democrats want to reinstate it to rein in right-leaning talk radio.
author: tedstew
